page.title: 17BRITISH RAIL ABERDYFI
page.content: Aberdyfi lies on the Machynlleth to Pwllheli section of the{Cambrian Coast {Railway.}The present village is served by two unstaffed stations. Opened in 1867 and absorbed into the G.W.R.in 1924 the line has never been very busy: {YEAR. No.TRAINS/DAY. { }1869 8 1904 14 1943 11 1985 18 Maintenance costs exaggerated by the gradual subsidence of the Barmouth Viaduct has meant that during recent years there has been a question mark over the lines future.However,a modernisation programme involving radio signalling and the new Class 150 {SPRINTER}in 1986 suggests a certain commitment to the future but only time will tell.
